context_meta.title: Yellowstone supervolcano may have underwater magma 'anomaly,' researchers suggest
context_meta.summary: An underwater river or "fountain" of magma has been located underneath the Yellowstone supervolcano. Despite fears that this could trigger a major eruption in the near future, experts say it's not expected to blow anytime soon. According to a research paper published in Nature this week, scientists Peter Nelson and Stephen Grand believe the magma may stretch as far as Mexico. The researchers describe "a single narrow, cylindrically shaped slow anomaly, approximately 350 km in diameter that we interpret as a whole-mantle plume," according to the study's abstract. When LaVar pulled LaMelo out of high school over a strategic disagreement with new head coach Dennis Latimore (he wouldn't let LaMelo take 50 shots a game), Chino Hills was left without its star player. The Huskies had a rough go early in the season, and LaMelo mocked the team's struggles in a November tweet, calling them the worst. The Huskies would have the last laugh, though. context_meta.author: Yahoo News
context_meta.title: Federal prosecutors told to seek death penalty in drug cases
context_meta.summary: By Sarah N. Lynch WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. Attorney General Jeff Sessions instructed federal prosecutors on Wednesday to seek the death penalty in drug-related cases whenever it is "appropriate," saying the Justice Department must boost efforts to counter America's epidemic of opioid abuse. The call for greater use of the death penalty in federal drug cases has already sparked a backlash from criminal justice reform groups. While the death penalty is used in the United States, it is generally handed down in federal cases only in connection with the most heinous crimes.

context_meta.title: Karen McDougal is the woman with the best chance of bringing down Trump
context_meta.summary: There has been extensive media coverage of Stormy Daniels, the adult film star who says she had an affair with Donald Trump in 2006. Daniels' new attorney, Michael Avenatti, has been a fixture on TV. Daniels herself is scheduled to be interviewed on 60 Minutes on March 25. But another woman, former Playboy Playmate Karen McDougal, whose story has attracted significantly less attention, may end up being a bigger problem for Trump. (McDougal will appear on TV this Thursday on CNN with Anderson Cooper.) In some respects, McDougal's story is similar to Daniels'. Like Daniels, she met Trump at a 2006 golf tournament in Lake Tahoe. Trump later wined and dined both women at the Beverly Hills Hotel.

context_meta.summary: Former Victoria's Secret model Rosie Huntington-Whiteley might have shared this swimwear secret with fellow model Lily Aldridge: where to find a cute terry cloth swimsuit. Rosie first wore this brown one-piece from Hunza G, and now Lily's chosen the same brand too, rocking not one but two different items from the swim label. While on vacation, Lily snapped herself chilling poolside in an orange bikini. We immediately took note of the material — terry cloth isn't a common find! — and thought it was perfect for vacation. Before we even had time to scoop up her exact piece, however, Lily debuted another one-shoulder Hunza G swimsuit. This one was nearly identical to Rosie's, save for the red hue.

She would never leave me alone.” For more than 50 years, the disappearance of 38-year-old Louise Pietrewicz has been an unsolved mystery in Suffolk County, where she vanished without a trace other than a pocketbook found days later on the side of Route 25. The word in question is "gook," a derogatory term used when referring to people from East Asia. Although Jennifer wasn't happy with having to explain the meaning of the word to Emily, it did help her teach her daughter a valuable lesson. But upon receiving a breakfast sandwich with sausage instead, the woman became angry. “What the [expletive] is this?
